name: Split-Tail Miko
text: {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: "I wish there were no use for those with my talents. I wish that I could walk Kamigawa forgotten and unneeded, with no war wounds to heal and no broken bones to mend."

name: Splitting Headache
text:
Choose one —
• Target player discards two cards.
• Target player reveals his or her hand, you choose a card from it, then that player discards that card.

editions.flavor: All faeries delve for dreams. But not all wait for their victims to fall asleep.

name: Splitting Slime
text:
{4}{G}{G}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Splitting Slime becomes monstrous, create a token that's a copy of Splitting Slime. (The token has no counters and isn't monstrous.)

name: Spoils of Blood
text: Create an X/X black Horror creature token, where X is the number of creatures that died this turn.

editions.flavor:
"There are always leftovers."
—Derecht, flesh carver

name: Spoils of Evil
text: For each artifact or creature card in target opponent's graveyard, add {C} to your mana pool and you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"Virtue has its rewards, as does its opposite."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Spoils of the Vault
text: Name a card. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card, then put that card into your hand. Exile all other cards revealed this way, and you lose 1 life for each of the exiled cards.

name: Spoils of Victory
text: Search your library for a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, or Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Spoils of War
text:
X is the number of artifact and/or creature cards in an opponent's graveyard as you cast Spoils of War.
Distribute X +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.

editions.flavor:
"This is the fun part!"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

name: Spontaneous Artist
text:
When Spontaneous Artist enters the battlefield, you get {E} (an energy counter).
Pay {E}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Graffiti of the "leaking spire" symbol is found wherever the renegades have been.

name: Spontaneous Combustion
text:
As an additional cost to cast Spontaneous Combustion, sacrifice a creature.
Spontaneous Combustion deals 3 damage to each creature.

editions.flavor: "Heat of battle" is usually a metaphor.
"Heat of battle" is usually a metaphor.

name: Spontaneous Generation
text: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor: Saprolings always thrive on the ruins of others, and Mercadia ruins more than most.

name: Spontaneous Mutation
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-0, where X is the number of cards in your graveyard.

name: Sporeback Troll
text:
Graft 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it. Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may move a +1/+1 counter from this creature onto it.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate target creature with a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Spore Burst
text: Domain — Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each basic land type among lands you control.

editions.flavor: Seeds from Jund don't drift gently on the wind. They get up and stampede.

name: Sporecap Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor:
"They don't move much, but then again, if you get caught in its web, it has all the time in the world to get to you."
—Saidah, Joraga hunter

"They don't move much, but then again, if you get caught in its web, it has all the time in the world to get to you."
—Saidah, Joraga hunter

name: Spore Cloud
text: Tap all blocking creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Each attacking creature and each blocking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

name: Spore Flower
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Spore Flower.
Remove three spore counters from Spore Flower: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

name: Spore Frog
text: Sacrifice Spore Frog: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

editions.flavor: The end of one life is merely the beginning of thousands more.

name: Sporemound
text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

editions.flavor:
"If you threaten its territory, it produces spores. Actually, no matter what you do, it produces spores."
—Hadi Kasten, Calla Dale naturalist

name: Sporesower Thallid
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on each Fungus you control.
Remove three spore counters from Sporesower Thallid: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

name: Sporogenesis
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a fungus counter on target nontoken creature.
Whenever a creature with a fungus counter on it dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each fungus counter on that creature.
When Sporogenesis leaves the battlefield, remove all fungus counters from all creatures.

name: Sporoloth Ancient
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Sporoloth Ancient.
Creatures you control have "Remove two spore counters from this creature: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token."

name: Spotted Griffin
text: Flying

editions.flavor: When the cat flies and the bird stalks, guard your horses carefully.
When the cat flies and the bird stalks, guard your horses carefully.

name: Spreading Algae
text:
Enchant Swamp
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Spreading Algae is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spreading Algae to its owner's hand.

name: Spreading Flames
text: Spreading Flames deals 6 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

editions.flavor:
"Hang on. I'm just tidying up."
—Chandra Nalaar

name: Spreading Plague
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, destroy all other creatures that share a color with it. They can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: The cruelest strain of plague keeps its hosts alive long enough to return home and infect their families.

name: Spreading Seas
text:
Enchant land
When Spreading Seas enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted land is an Island.

editions.flavor: Most inhabitants of Zendikar have given up on the idea of an accurate map.

name: Spread the Sickness
text: Destroy target creature, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)

editions.flavor: Life is ephemeral. Phyrexia is eternal.
Life is ephemeral. Phyrexia is eternal.

name: Spring
text: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

name: Spring Cleaning
text: Destroy target enchantment. Clash with an opponent. If you win, destroy all enchantments your opponents control. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Springing Tiger
text: Threshold — Springing Tiger gets +2/+2 as long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

editions.flavor: The ground trembled in a violent purr.

name: Springjack Knight
text: Whenever Springjack Knight attacks, clash with an opponent. If you win, target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Springjack Pasture
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{4}, {T}: Create a 0/1 white Goat creature token.
{T}, Sacrifice X Goats: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool. You gain X life.

name: Springjack Shepherd
text: Chroma — When Springjack Shepherd enters the battlefield, create a 0/1 white Goat creature token for each white mana symbol in the mana costs of permanents you control.

editions.flavor: "Better for a doun to lose its cenn than its springjacks."

name: Springleaf Drum
text: {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "The music is in the drum. I simply coax it out to be heard."
After trying mudskippers for an afternoon, Scratch decided that crickcarp made the best noise.

name: Spring of Eternal Peace
text: You gain 8 life.

editions.flavor: Bathing in this spring could cure ailments of body and mind alike.

name: Springsage Ritual
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.

editions.flavor:
"Every evil destroyed is a strike against the enemy."
—Erold, Gatstaf springsage

name: Sprinting Warbrute
text:
Sprinting Warbrute attacks each turn if able.
Dash {3}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

name: Sprite Noble
text:
Flying
Other creatures you control with flying get +0/+1.
{T}: Other creatures you control with flying get +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "By thorn and by stone, we will fight to see the day when beauty returns to this world."
"By thorn and by stone, we will fight to see the day when beauty returns to this world."

name: Sprout
text: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

editions.flavor: Centuries of temporal strife had stripped Dominaria of its natural defenses, but nature fought back with armies constructed of little more than grime and sunlight.

name: Sprouting Phytohydra
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Sprouting Phytohydra is dealt damage, you may create a token that's a copy of Sprouting Phytohydra.

editions.flavor: A hydra tender's problem isn't having enough defenses but enough pots.

name: Sprouting Thrinax
text: When Sprouting Thrinax dies, create three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.

editions.flavor: The vast network of predation on Jund has actually caused some strange creatures to adapt to being eaten.
The vast network of predation on Jund has actually caused some strange creatures to adapt to being eaten.
The vast network of predation on Jund has actually caused some strange creatures to adapt to being eaten.
The vast network of predation on Jund has actually caused some strange creatures to adapt to being eaten.

name: Sprouting Vines
text:
Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

name: Sprout Swarm
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

name: Spur Grappler
text: Spur Grappler gets +2/+1 as long as you control no untapped lands.

editions.flavor: Grapplers hunt in packs, driving their victims over steep mountain cliffs.

name: Spurnmage Advocate
text: {T}: Return two target cards from an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Destroy target attacking creature.

editions.flavor: "Our unity humbles our foes."
"Our unity humbles our foes."

name: Spurred Wolverine
text: Tap two untapped Beasts you control: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor: After a few painful experiences, goblins learned not to pick their noses around the beasts.

name: Spy Kit
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and has all names of nonlegendary creature cards in addition to its name.
Equip {2}

editions.flavor: Imitation is the sincerest form of treachery.

name: Spy Network
text: Look at target player's hand, the top card of that player's library, and any face-down creatures he or she controls. Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

name: Squadron Hawk
text:
Flying
When Squadron Hawk enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Squadron Hawk, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

name: Squall
text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.

editions.flavor:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . .
The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam

"May the winds blow till they have wakened death. . . ."
—William Shakespeare,
Othello
The air that holds them aloft can just as easily put them down.

"To-night the winds begin to rise . . .
The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam

name: Squall Drifter
text:
Flying
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor:
"The scouts claim the cold has malice, and a mind. I begin to believe them. Impassable drifts seem to appear before us at every turn."
—Aevar Borg, northern guide, journal entry

name: Squall Line
text: Squall Line deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

editions.flavor: The constant shifting of Dominaria's shredded timeline played havoc with its atmosphere, combining savage electrical storms from ages past.

name: Squallmonger
text: {2}: Squallmonger deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. Any player may activate this ability.

editions.flavor: "Squall, gale, hurricane—it's all a matter of size . . . and price."
"Squall, gale, hurricane—it's all a matter of size . . . and price."

name: Squandered Resources
text: Sacrifice a land: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type the sacrificed land could produce.

editions.flavor:
"He traded sand for skins, skins for gold, gold for life. In the end, he traded life for sand."
—Afari, Tales

name: Squeaking Pie Grubfellows
text: Kinship — At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with Squeaking Pie Grubfellows, you may reveal it. If you do, each opponent discards a card.

name: Squeaking Pie Sneak
text:
As an additional cost to cast Squeaking Pie Sneak, reveal a Goblin card from your hand or pay {3}.
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor:
"Why do our pies squeak? It's all the faeries, mice, and prickly-hogs we stuff inside."
—Borb of the Squeaking Pie warren

name: Squealing Devil
text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Squealing Devil enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
When Squealing Devil enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless {B} was spent to cast it.

name: Squee
text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.

editions.flavor: The smartest—and only—goblin cabin boy aboard the Weatherlight, Squee has learned that intelligence and common sense are very different things. This matters little, however, since he has neither. Fortunately, he doesn't know what he's missing.

name: Squee, Goblin Nabob
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return Squee, Goblin Nabob from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"Some goblins are expendable. Some are impossible to get rid of. But he's both—at the same time!"
—Starke
"General?!" Tahngarth roared. "General nuisance, maybe."

"Some goblins are expendable. Some are impossible to get rid of. But he's both—at the same time!"
—Starke

name: Squee, Goblin Nabob Avatar
text: {1}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control this turn.

editions.flavor: 10E Prize Avatar

name: Squee's Embrace
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to its owner's hand.

name: Squee's Revenge
text: Choose a number. Flip a coin that many times or until you lose a flip, whichever comes first. If you win all the flips, draw two cards for each flip.

name: Squee's Toy
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

editions.flavor: As the horrors closed in on Gerrard, Squee trembled and clutched his toy for comfort. He didn't know where it came from or why it was so warm, but he was glad he'd kept it near.

name: Squeeze
text: Sorcery spells cost {3} more to cast.

editions.flavor: Any pirate would prefer Rishada's swift and cruel justice to Saprazzo's patient punishments.

name: Squelch
text:
Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Oku-Doku had gone through all the motions: the same akki cursewords, the same ingredients with their horrid stink, the same rude gestures. Yet not a person died.

name: Squelching Leeches
text: Squelching Leeches's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

editions.flavor: Leeches are sacred to followers of Pharika for drawing poison from a wound, but feared by everyone else for drawing blood from the flesh.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis
editions.flavor: Setting foot in their muck is an open invitation.

"Of twenty yeer of age he was, I gesse.
Of his stature he was of evene lengthe.
And wonderly delyvere, and of greete strengthe."
—Geoffrey Chaucer,
The Canterbury Tales
"Of twenty yeer of age he was, I gesse. Of his stature he was of even lengthe. And wonderly deliver, and greete of strengthe." —Geoffrey Chaucer, The Canterbury Tales

name: Squirming Mass
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

editions.flavor: Only the coldest hearts and the strongest stomachs can stand against it.

name: Squirrel Farm
text: {1}{G}: Choose a card in your hand. Covering the artist's name, reveal the card to target player. If that player cannot name the artist, reveal the artist's name and put a Squirrel token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 green creature.

editions.flavor:
"And the ignorant shall fall to the squirrels."
—Chip 2:54

name: Squirrel Mob
text: Squirrel Mob gets +1/+1 for each other Squirrel on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: An army of squirrels is still an army.

name: Squirrel Nest
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token."

editions.flavor: In the treetops, unseen by many, lurks chittering, skittering death.
In the Krosan Forest, you've got to keep an eye out for the squirrels.

name: Squirrel Wrangler
text:
{1}{G}, Sacrifice a land: Create two 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice a land: Squirrel creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Gnawed to death. Bad way to go."

name: Sram, Senior Edificer
text: Whenever you cast an Aura, Equipment, or Vehicle spell, draw a card.

editions.flavor: "As this conflict grows, it gets harder to prevent the city from breaking down. How much longer can we keep this machinery balanced?"

name: Sram's Expertise
text:
Create three 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature tokens.
You may cast a card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your hand without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: "It's important to always have the right tool for the job. This one is for picking my teeth."

name: Stabbing Pain
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Tap that creature.

editions.flavor:
"You can take the fight out of nearly any creature if you know where its soft spot is."
—Guttor, flesh-warper

name: Stabilizer
text: Players can't cycle cards.

editions.flavor:
"Hold that thought."
—Pemmin, Riptide survivor

name: Stabwhisker the Odious
text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, that player loses 1 life for each card fewer than three in his or her hand.

name: Stab Wound
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 2 life.

name: Staff of Domination
text:
{1}: Untap Staff of Domination.
{2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
{3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
{4}, {T}: Tap target creature.
{5}, {T}: Draw a card.

name: Staff of Nin
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card.
{T}: Staff of Nin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"I have attuned the staff to your screams so that only I may benefit from your pain."
—Volux, disciple of Nin
"I have attuned the staff to your screams so that only I may benefit from your pain."—Volux, disciple of Nin

"I have attuned the staff to your screams so that only I may benefit from your pain."
—Volux, disciple of Nin

name: Staff of the Ages
text: Creatures with landwalk abilities can be blocked as though they didn't have those abilities.

editions.flavor:
"We found this staff useful on our visit to this very commission. Would Relicbane prefer we had been slain by Lim-Dûl's horrors?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

name: Staff of the Death Magus
text: Whenever you cast a black spell or a Swamp enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: A symbol of ambition in ruthless times.
A symbol of ambition in ruthless times.

name: Staff of the Flame Magus
text: Whenever you cast a red spell or a Mountain enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: A symbol of passion in indifferent times.
A symbol of passion in indifferent times.

name: Staff of the Mind Magus
text: Whenever you cast a blue spell or an Island enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: A symbol of sagacity in bewildering times.
A symbol of sagacity in bewildering times.

name: Staff of the Sun Magus
text: Whenever you cast a white spell or a Plains enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: A symbol of conviction in uncertain times.
A symbol of conviction in uncertain times.

name: Staff of the Wild Magus
text: Whenever you cast a green spell or a Forest enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: A symbol of ferocity in oppressive times.
A symbol of ferocity in oppressive times.

name: Staff of Zegon
text: {3}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Though Mishra was impressed by the staves Ashnod had created for Zegon's defense, he understood they only hinted at her full potential.
Though Mishra was impressed by the staves Ashnod had created for Zegon's defense, he understood they only hinted at her full potential.

name: Stag Beetle
text: Stag Beetle enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of other creatures on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Its voice crackles with the hum of a thousand wings beating at once.

name: Staggershock
text:
Staggershock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

name: Stain the Mind
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Name a nonland card. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

name: Stairs to Infinity
text:
Players have no maximum hand size.
Whenever you roll the planar die, draw a card.
Whenever you roll CHAOS, reveal the top card of your planar deck. You may put it on the bottom of your planar deck.

name: Stalker Hag
text: Swampwalk, forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp or a Forest.)

editions.flavor: Her hunt is silent until a bone snaps or flesh tears. Her victims never know to scream.

name: Stalking Assassin
text:
{3}{U}, {T}: Tap target creature.
{3}{B}, {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.

name: Stalking Bloodsucker
text:
Flying
{1}{B}, Discard a card: Stalking Bloodsucker gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The pits feed both its thirst for combat and its thirst for blood.

name: Stalking Drone
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{C}: Stalking Drone gets +1/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

editions.flavor: As the Eldrazi adapted to the jungles of Zendikar, some took on the tactics of more familiar predators.

name: Stalking Stones
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{6}: Stalking Stones becomes a 3/3 Elemental artifact creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Stalking Tiger
text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.

editions.flavor: In the Jamuraan jungles, there is often no separating beauty from danger.
No one is happy when they notice a tiger.
In the Jamuraan jungles, there is often no separating beauty from danger.
In the Jamuraan jungles, there is often no separating beauty from danger.
Throughout Chinese history, generals have often been referred to as tigers for their fierceness, strength, and bravery.

name: Stalking Tiger Avatar
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor: MI Participation Avatar
